intro: Calectasia palustris, commonly known as the swamp calectasia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the wetlands of southern Australia. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae, which includes several species of flowering plants. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale blue in color. Calectasia palustris thrives in moist, swampy environments and is often found in areas with poor drainage. It plays an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various insects and small animals.
